gable.name: Gable Roof
gable.description: Simple triangular shape formed by two sloping sides meeting at a ridge. Most cost-effective and suitable for most climates.
gable.bestFor: Most residential applications, budget-conscious projects, areas with moderate weather

hip.name: Hip Roof
hip.description: Four sloping sides that meet at the top, providing excellent wind resistance and a more complex but elegant appearance.
hip.bestFor: High-wind areas, modern homes, architectural variety
hip.complexity: Medium - More complex framing and material requirements

mansard.name: Mansard Roof
mansard.description: French architectural style with steep lower slopes and flatter upper slopes, maximizing living space and providing distinctive character.
mansard.bestFor: French colonial homes, maximizing attic space, historic renovations
mansard.complexity: High - Complex framing and specialized installation

shed.name: Shed Roof
shed.description: Single sloping plane that provides modern aesthetics and excellent water runoff. Simple construction with contemporary appeal.
shed.bestFor: Modern homes, additions, excellent water drainage needs

gambrel.name: Gambrel Roof
gambrel.description: Two slopes per side, creating a barn-like appearance. Provides more space than a simple gable while maintaining structural simplicity.
gambrel.bestFor: Barn conversions, Dutch colonial homes, maximizing attic space
gambrel.complexity: Medium - More complex framing than simple gable

cross-gabled.name: Cross-Gabled Roof
cross-gabled.description: Multiple gables intersecting at different angles, creating complex valleys and architectural interest with varied rooflines.
cross-gabled.bestFor: Complex architectural designs, multi-wing homes, Victorian styles
cross-gabled.complexity: High - Complex valley installation and water management

saltbox.name: Saltbox Roof
saltbox.description: Asymmetrical gable with one long sloping side and one short side, creating a distinctive colonial American appearance.
saltbox.bestFor: Colonial homes, historic renovations, unique architectural character

butterfly.name: Butterfly Roof
butterfly.description: Inverted gable that creates a V-shape, allowing for unique drainage patterns and modern architectural expression.
butterfly.bestFor: Modern homes, rainwater collection, contemporary design
butterfly.complexity: High - Specialized drainage and structural requirements
